HSBC downgrades Indian markets to 'neutral', cuts Sensex target by 5,000 points - CNBCTV18
summary:
HSBC Downgrades Indian Markets to 'Neutral', Cuts Sensex Target by 5,000 Points

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

HSBC has downgraded Indian stock markets to a 'neutral' stance and reduced its Sensex target, indicating a shift in market sentiment.

  • HSBC has cut its 2025-end Sensex target to 85,990 from 90,520, suggesting a 10% upside from current levels.
  • The downgrade follows a noticeable slowdown in profits and elevated valuations.
  • HSBC maintains an 'overweight' stance on Chinese markets, with specific upgrades across Hong Kong and South Korea.
  • The firm notes that growth estimates for the Nifty 50 have been reduced significantly.
  • Despite the downgrade, India remains the strongest growth story among emerging markets.
"As earnings disappoint, consensus has cut its financial year 2025 growth estimates for the Nifty 50 to 5% from 15% earlier." - HSBC

The downgrade from HSBC indicates a cautious outlook for Indian markets amidst rising challenges, yet underscores the potential for future recovery driven by rural demand.
newTitle: HSBC Downgrades Indian Markets to 'Neutral', Cuts Sensex Target by 5,000 Points

Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who is SN Subrahmanyan, L&T chairman under fire for ‘90-hour work week’ remark?

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

SN Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen & Toubro (L&T), faced backlash for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays. His remarks sparked a significant response from the public and celebrities alike.

  • Subrahmanyan joined L&T in 1984 and became chairman and MD in October 2023.
  • His comments have been criticized by various stakeholders, including actress Deepika Padukone.
  • Subrahmanyan has overseen several major projects during his tenure at L&T.
  • He has received multiple awards and accolades, including the Eminent Engineer award in 2024.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

The incident has triggered discussions around work-life balance and employee well-being in a corporate context.
newTitle: Who is L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan and Why is He Under Fire?

title: Stocks to Watch on January 10: TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, Phoenix Mills and more - CNBCTV18
summary:
Stocks to Watch on January 10: TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, Phoenix Mills and More

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to monitor in the market today, including TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, and others. It covers corporate earnings, profit changes, and significant business announcements.

  • TCS: Reported an 11.95% increase in net profit to ₹12,380 crore.
  • IREDA: Achieved a 26.8% year-on-year increase in net profit for Q3 FY25.
  • Adani Wilmar: Announced a 13.5% stake sale through an OFS by its founder.
  • Adani Total Gas: Confirmed a 20% increase in APM gas allocation starting January 16, 2025.
  • Phoenix Mills: Reported a 21% rise in retail consumption for Q3 FY25.
  • GTPL Hathway: Experienced a 57.2% YoY decline in net profit.
  • Indian Overseas Bank: Invited EOIs for the sale of 46 NPA accounts valued at ₹11,500 crore.
  • Reliance Industries: Will announce its Q3 results on January 16, 2025.
  • Tata Elxsi: Reported a 13.3% decline in net profit for the December quarter.
  • Hindustan Zinc: Disclosed a penalty of ₹35.35 crore from the State Tax department.
  • BGR Energy Systems: Cleared previous tax liabilities, confirmed by a rectification order.
  • Polyplex Corporation: Planning new BOPET manufacturing capacity expansion in India.
"This upward revision will have a positive impact on the company and will help in stabilizing the retail prices to end consumers." - Adani Total Gas statement

The article underscores significant corporate developments and market shifts that investors should monitor, suggesting potential investment opportunities.
newTitle: Stocks to Watch on January 10: TCS, IREDA, Adani Wilmar, Phoenix Mills and More

title: IREDA Q3 results: Net profits rise 27% YoY to ₹425.35 crore; revenue up 37% | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
IREDA Q3 results: Net profits rise 27% YoY to ₹425.35 crore; revenue up 37%

Date: January 9, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) has reported a significant increase in net profits and revenue for the third quarter of the financial year 2024-25, reflecting a positive performance amidst rising expenses.

  • Net profits rose 27% to ₹425.38 crore compared to ₹335.53 crore in the same quarter last year.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 37% to ₹1,654.45 crore from ₹1,208.10 crore.
  • Total expenses for the quarter grew by 33.8% to ₹1,160.78 crore.
  • IREDA shares closed 3.31% lower at ₹215.90 after the results were released.
  • Gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped to 2.68%, down from 2.90% year-over-year.
“IREDA's net worth surged 21% to ₹9,842.07 crore in the third quarter, compared to ₹8,134.56 crore a year ago.”

This positive performance in net profits and revenue highlights IREDA's robust growth and resilience amidst challenging market conditions, suggesting a strong outlook for the company in the renewable energy sector.
newTitle: IREDA Q3 results: Net profits rise 27% YoY to ₹425.35 crore; revenue up 37%

title: Watch | ‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage - The Indian Express
summary:
L&T Chairman Faces Backlash Over Call for 90-Hour Workweeks

Publication Date: January 9, 2025
Source: NextBigWhat.com

In a now-viral video, Larsen & Toubro Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has sparked significant criticism for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays.

Subrahmanyan's comments, made during a recent employee interaction, jokingly challenged staff on their weekend activities, suggesting they should be working instead. He also expressed his desire to make employees work on Sundays, emphasizing that he does so himself.

  • Subrahmanyan's comments follow similar remarks by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy, who advocates for longer workweeks in India.
  • Critics slammed the corporate culture at L&T, emphasizing poor working conditions and a high turnover rate.
  • Social media users reacted with humor and outrage, with some highlighting the unrealistic expectations placed on workers.
  • The broader implications of these comments lead to discussions about work-life balance within India's corporate sector.
“How long will you stare at your wife?” L&T chairman wants you to work on Sundays also!

In response, L&T issued a statement asserting that such remarks reflect their ambition for nation-building, although they have faced backlash for implying a lack of respect for employees' personal time.

Overall, this incident has reignited the ongoing debate in India regarding work-life balance and the expectations placed upon employees in the private sector.
newTitle: L&T Chairman Faces Backlash Over Call for 90-Hour Workweeks

title: Double counting error: Official gold import figures for Nov revised down by $5 billion - The Indian Express
summary:
Gold Import Figures Revised Down by $5 Billion Due to Counting Error

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry has revised down the gold import figures for November by $5 billion, highlighting a likely counting error.

  • The revised gold import figures for November are now $9.9 billion instead of the previously reported $14.8 billion.
  • The overall goods trade deficit for the month decreased from $38 billion to $33 billion.
  • The counting error estimated November gold imports at 180 tonnes, which is three times the average for the first ten months of the year.
  • The government has not yet provided an official explanation for the counting error.
  • There was a likely $3-4 billion revision due to a calculation error linked to the recent shift in e-filing services.
The Ministry has yet to clarify the situation regarding the counting error.

This revision sheds light on the importance and volatility of gold imports in India’s economy.
newTitle: Gold Import Figures Revised Down by $5 Billion Due to Counting Error

IREDA Q3 results FY2024-25: PSU reports 35% jump in total income - Check PAT, EBITDA and key earnings - ET Now
summary:
IREDA Q3 results FY2024-25: PSU reports 35% jump in total income

Updated: January 9, 2025 | Source: ET NOW

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency Limited (IREDA) reported a significant increase in total income and net profit for the third quarter of FY25, reflecting strong growth in its operations.

  • Total income grew by 35% to Rs 1698.98 crore.
  • Net profit rose by 27% to Rs 425.38 crore compared to Rs 335.53 crore in the same quarter of the previous year.
  • Shares of IREDA fell by 3.42% to Rs 215.75.
  • Loan sanctions jumped 129% year-on-year to Rs 31,087 crore.
  • Outstanding loan book reached Rs 69,000 crore, up 36% from a year earlier.
“The agency provides critical financial support and services to boost green power capacity.”

This growth underscores IREDA's expanding role in the renewable energy sector, promoting sustainable development through increased loan disbursements and sanctions.
newTitle: IREDA Q3 results FY2024-25: PSU reports 35% jump in total income - Check PAT, EBITDA and key earnings

title: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

Thursday's trading session favored the bears as the market saw a broad-based sell-off, with the Nifty 50 slipping below 23,550. Most sectors faced losses, but the Nifty's direction for the week hinges on the results from TCS, India's largest IT services company.

  • The Nifty 50 index ended at 23,526.50, nearing the day’s low.
  • TCS's revenue for the December quarter was ₹63,973 crore, down 0.4% from the previous quarter.
  • Foreign investors were net sellers while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • The Nifty has declined over 2% for the week.
TCS reported a revenue in US Dollar terms of $7,539 million, slightly below the expected $7,626 million.

This trading dynamic showcases the significance of TCS’s quarterly results on the broader market, particularly within the IT sector.
newTitle: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

Innovaccer aims to become healthcare’s AI powerhouse with $275M Series F - TechCrunch
summary:
Innovaccer aims to become healthcare's AI powerhouse with $275M Series F

Date: [insert publication date]Source: TechCrunch

Innovaccer, a leading San Francisco-based healthcare data platform, has announced a $275 million Series F funding round to propel its development of AI solutions aimed at unifying patient data across the healthcare sector.

  • The company currently serves six of the top ten healthcare systems in the U.S.
  • Innovaccer is set to launch AI tools including an AI medical scribe and solutions for handling prior authorizations and denied claims.
  • The latest funding round brings Innovaccer's post-money valuation to approximately $3.45 billion.
  • Its revenue has seen a consistent annual growth rate of 50% over the past five years, with a projected ARR of $250 million this year.
  • The company aims to integrate AI into its existing platform as it prepares for a potential IPO in the future.
“Healthcare lived in a pre-internet era. There was no connected fabric of information that existed.” - Abhinav Shashank

Innovaccer is focused on becoming a comprehensive provider of healthcare AI solutions, facilitating the management of vast amounts of data in the industry.
newTitle: Innovaccer Secures $275M in Series F Funding to Expand AI Healthcare Solutions

title: ‘Absolutely not okay’: NRAI opposes Zomato, Swiggy’s foray into 10-minute food delivery; threatens legal action - The Financial Express
summary:
NRAI Opposes Zomato and Swiggy's 10-Minute Food Delivery Venture

Date: Thursday
Source: Financial Express

The National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) has raised strong concerns against Zomato and Swiggy's entry into private-label food delivery, arguing it threatens restaurant survival and violates marketplace neutrality.

  • NRAI represents over 500,000 restaurants in India.
  • They claim that Zomato and Swiggy are abusing their market power to launch competing food products.
  • The NRAI stresses that this strategy undermines fair competition and could violate copyright laws.
  • The NRAI's President, Sagar Daryani, expressed disappointment over broken assurances from food aggregators.
  • Concerns were raised about consumer data access and the potential for conflict of interest.
  • The NRAI plans to seek legal remedies and engage regulators.
  • They emphasize the need for collaboration to sustain the restaurant industry's growth, valued at ₹5.69 lakh crore.
“We were always given verbal assurances by the aggregators that they would never resort to private labelling. This is a breach of trust.” - Sagar Daryani

The NRAI's actions reflect significant apprehensions regarding competition and consumer protection in the food delivery sector.
newTitle: NRAI Opposes Zomato and Swiggy's 10-Minute Food Delivery Venture

summary:
Q3 results preview: Weak O2C biz likely to drag earnings for RIL again

Last Updated: January 09, 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) is expected to see its core business negatively impact earnings in the third quarter of financial year 2025.

  • Earnings estimates for RIL are forecasted to either remain flat or decline marginally at the Ebitda level compared to the previous year.
  • The company is set to declare its financial results for Q3FY25 on January 16.
  • A Bloomberg poll predicts a consolidated revenue of Rs 2.37 trillion and adjusted net income estimates from analysts.
“Company’s Ebitda may remain flat or decline marginally, say analysts.”

The anticipated earnings report may reflect ongoing challenges within RIL's oil-to-telecom core business, suggesting a need for stakeholders to closely monitor the upcoming results.
newTitle: Q3 results preview: Weak O2C biz likely to drag earnings for RIL again

Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India - The Indian Express
summary:
Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

As Meta winds down its third-party fact-checking program in the US, uncertainty looms for fact-checkers in India, many of whom depend on Meta for funding and visibility.

  • Meta announced halting its third-party fact-checking program in the US, replacing it with community-driven systems.
  • Indian fact-checkers are concerned about potential funding losses and reduced traffic to their websites.
  • Meta collaborates with 12 fact-checking partners in India, including major publishers and smaller entities.
  • Meta’s shift may be motivated by a new alignment with the Trump administration.
“This is possibly the biggest existential threat many fact checkers will have to contend with.” - Anonymous Senior Executive from a Fact-Checking Organization

The changes by Meta could have lasting implications for media credibility in regions reliant on their fact-checking programs.
newTitle: Meta's Decision on Fact-Checking Sparks Concerns in India

title: Deepika Padukone calls out L&T chairman for wanting employees to work everyday: ‘Shocking to see such…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Deepika Padukone Criticizes L&T Chairman's Comments on Employee Work Hours

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Larsen & Toubro's chairman, SN Subrahmanyan, sparked controversy with his remarks about employees working on Sundays. Deepika Padukone, a known mental health advocate, criticized these comments, highlighting the importance of work-life balance.

  • Deepika Padukone reacted to SN Subrahmanyan's comments regarding workplace expectations.
  • Subrahmanyan suggested that employees should work on Sundays, which is deemed unusual in modern workplaces.
  • His comments included questioning how employees spend their downtime at home.
  • Deepika expressed her shock over such statements from someone in a senior position.
  • L&T responded by emphasizing their commitment to nation-building and the need for extraordinary effort.
  • Deepika has been a prominent advocate for mental health in India.
“Shocking to see people in such senior positions make such statements. #MentalHealthMatters.” - Deepika Padukone

In conclusion, the incident has ignited discussions on work-life balance and corporate culture, prompting a closer look at the expectations placed on employees in large organizations.
newTitle: Deepika Padukone Criticizes L&T Chairman's Comments on Employee Work Hours

title: TCS Q3 results takeaways: Profit, dividend, attrition rate among 5 key details to know - The Economic Times
TCS Q3 results take aways: Profit, dividend, attrition rate, among 5 key details to know - The Economic Times
summary:
TCS Q3 Results: Key Takeaways on Profit, Dividend, and Attrition

Publication Date: Thursday, January 18, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a 12% rise in consolidated net profit for Q3 FY2024, reaching Rs 12,380 crore. The results highlight the company's robust performance amid market challenges.

  • Consolidated Net Profit: Rs 12,380 crore, up from Rs 11,058 crore year-on-year.
  • Revenue: Rs 63,973 crore with a 5.6% increase compared to the previous year.
  • Dividend Declared: Total of Rs 76 per share, including a special dividend of Rs 66.
  • Total Contract Value (TCV): Grew to $10.2 billion with a book-to-bill ratio of 1.4.
  • Attrition Rate: Last twelve months attrition in IT services stands at 13.0%.
“BFSI and CBG returning to growth, continued stellar run of Regional Markets and early signs of revival in discretionary spend give us confidence for the future.” - K. Krithivasan, CEO

The strong financial performance and strategic initiatives position TCS for sustained growth despite market volatility.
newTitle: TCS Q3 Results: Key Takeaways on Profit, Dividend, and Attrition
